Class Hero

java.lang.Object
Hero
public class Hero extends Object
Represents the player-controlled hero in the game board. The hero has a position, a limited number of hearts (lives), and can place one active bomb at a time.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Hero(int x, int y, int hearts)
    Constructs a Hero object and initializes its starting position and hearts.

  • Constructor Details

    • Hero

      public Hero(int x, int y, int hearts)
      Constructs a Hero object and initializes its starting position and hearts.
      Parameters:
      x - the initial row position of the hero
      y - the initial column position of the hero
      hearts - the initial number of hearts (lives) the hero starts with

  • Method Details

    • loseHeart

      public void loseHeart()
      Decrements the hero's heart count by one, typically when hit by an explosion or even an enemy for future development.

    • getX

      public int getX()
      Returns the current row position of the hero.
      Returns:
      the hero's x-coordinate (row index)

    • getY

      public int getY()
      Returns the current column position of the hero.
      Returns:
      the hero's y-coordinate (column index)

    • getSymbol

      public char getSymbol()
      Returns the symbol used to visually represent the hero.
      Returns:
      the character symbol representing the hero

    • isValidated

      public boolean isValidated(int moveX, int moveY, GameBoard board)
      Validates whether a movement to a given tile is within the bounds of the board and whether that tile is walkable.
      Parameters:
      moveX - the target row to move to
      moveY - the target column to move to
      board - the game board used to check boundaries and walkability
      Returns:
      true if the target tile is inside bounds and walkable, false otherwise

    • moveHero

      public void moveHero(char keyPressed, GameBoard board, Bomb placedBomb)
      Moves the hero based on the key pressed and optionally places a bomb. Movement keys are W, A, S, D (or lowercase variants). Pressing H places a bomb on the current tile if no other bomb is active.
      Parameters:
      keyPressed - the character representing the player's movement or action input
      board - the current game board used for movement validation
      placedBomb - the bomb object to be placed when 'H' is pressed Precondition: No other bomb is currently active when placing a new one.

    • setHasActiveBomb

      public void setHasActiveBomb(boolean choice)
      Updates the hero's active bomb status.
      Parameters:
      choice - true if a bomb is now active, false once the bomb has exploded

    • getHearts

      public int getHearts()
      Returns:
      the remaining hearts of the hero

    • getActiveBombStatus

      public boolean getActiveBombStatus()
      Returns:
      true if a bomb is currently active, false otherwise
